intro: Hieracium macrocalathium, commonly known as the giant hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves that are broad and hairy, with a distinctive reddish or purple hue. Its stems are upright and can grow up to 1 meter in height, supporting the inflorescence. Hieracium macrocalathium is a member of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads and medicinal properties in some traditional uses.
